subsc: Health,General industry and trade sector,Banking,Compulsory pension and unemployment insurance,Central government administration

abstracts.cdata!:
The Structural Adjustment Loan Project
            will support the government's medium-term program of
            macroeconomic stabilization and broad-based structural
            reforms. The loan will recognize the major structural reform
            measures taken between August 1990 and December 1991, in
            macroeconomic policy, the fiscal sector, the social sector,
            privatization, agriculture, labor, and social security. The
            conditions in these areas include maintenance of current
            reforms and measures for future reforms and are set out in
            the Letter of Development Policy.
